sen.j: 津田 正信（つだ まさのぶ、生没年不詳）は室町時代の武将。
sen.e: Masanobu TSUDA (Date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Muromachi period.
Masanobu TSUDA (date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Dateを小文字に変えました。
sen.e: Masanobu TSUDA (date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Muromachi period.
He was Suo no kami in Suo Province.
He was Suo no kami in Suo Province.
He was Suo no kami in Suo Province.
He was an adopted child of Masanori KUSUNOKI.
He was an adopted child of Masanori KUSUNOKI..
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: He was an adopted child of Masanori KUSUNOKI..

sen.j: 1490年河内国交野郡の国見山に津田城を築城。
sen.e: In 1470, he constructed Tsuda-jo Castle at Mt. Kunimi in Katano County, Kawachi Province.
In 1470, he constructed Tsuda-jo Castle at Mt. Kunimi in Katano County, Kawachi Province.
In 1470, he constructed Tsuda-jo Castle at Mt. Kunimi in Katano County, Kawachi Province.

sen.j: この城は以後100年津田氏の支配が続く事になる。
sen.e: Tsuda clan ruled the castle for 100 years since the construction.
Tsuda clan ruled the castle for 100 years since the construction.
Tsuda clan ruled the castle for 100 years since the construction.

sen.j: 紀伊国の津田監物一族の先祖ともいわれる。
sen.e: He is said to be an ancestor of Kenmotsu TSUDA family in Kii Province.
He is said to be an ancestor of Kenmotsu TSUDA family in Kii Province.
